author: Reuters Editorial
title: Yield on Egyptian dollardenominated T-bill rises marginally -c.bank
text:
CAIRO, May 7 (Reuters) - The average yield at an auction of Egyptian one-year dollar-denominated treasury bills rose to 3.298 pct on Monday from 3.295 percent at the last similar auction in February.
Egypt sold $1.1 billion of the bills and received $1.28 billion in offers.
Appetite for Egyptâ€™s debt has grown since the central bank devalued the pound currency in November 2016 as part of a deal for a $12 billion International Monetary Fund loan. (Reporting by Eric Knecht; editing by John Stonestreet)
